alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 02 at 10:13AM MDT until May 06 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Idaho... Middle Fork Payette River Near Crouch affecting Boise Mountains zone. .Warm temperatures may melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Middle Fork Payette River Near Crouch. * WHEN...From this morning to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.8 feet, Low-lying areas near the intersection of Banks-Lowman Road and Middle Fork Road will be impacted by floodwaters. Water will encroach on Weilmunster Park and the Garden Valley Trail. The river will be out of its banks and impact adjacent lowlands from Crouch upriver past Elk Springs Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM MDT Tuesday the stage was 11.5 feet. - The river has been following it`s diurnal cycle this morning and is trending down reaching a low of 11.0 feet around 5 PM today. The river will rise tonight likely reaching flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 11.8 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 1200 PM MDT.
